Cookie Policy

Last updated:
October 3, 2025

This Cookie Policy explains how Eunika Agency (“we”, “us”, or “our”) uses cookies and similar technologies on our website https://eunika.agency (the “Website”).

By continuing to browse or use our Website, you agree that we can store and access cookies as described in this policy. You can manage your preferences at any time (see “Managing Cookies” below).

1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile) by a website. They help websites remember information about your visit, like your language preference or login status, and make the site work more efficiently.

Cookies can be:

  • Session cookies – deleted when you close your browser.

  • Persistent cookies – remain on your device until they expire or are deleted.

  • First-party cookies – set by the site you’re visiting.

  • Third-party cookies – set by external services (e.g., analytics, ads, embedded content).

2. Types of Cookies We Use

We use the following categories of cookies on our Website:

a. Strictly Necessary Cookies

  • Required for the Website to function properly.

  • Enable core features like security, network management, and accessibility.

  • Cannot be switched off in our systems.

  • Example: remembering your cookie consent preferences.

b. Performance & Analytics Cookies

  • Help us understand how visitors use our Website (e.g., pages visited, time spent).

  • Data is aggregated and anonymous.

  • Example: Google Analytics cookies that track overall traffic patterns.

c. Functional Cookies

  • Allow the Website to remember your preferences and provide enhanced functionality.

  • Example: remembering language settings or form inputs.

d. Targeting & Advertising Cookies (if applicable)

  • Used to deliver relevant ads and track campaign effectiveness.

  • May be set by third-party ad networks or social media platforms.

  • Example: Meta Pixel, Google Ads Remarketing.

Note: We do not sell your personal data. Any third-party cookies used follow their own privacy policies.

3. Third-Party Cookies

Some cookies on our site are placed by third parties. These may include:

  • Google Analytics / Tag Manager (website traffic analysis)

  • Facebook Pixel / Meta (ad conversion tracking)

  • Cloudflare (security and performance optimization)

  • WordPress plugins (functionality enhancements)

These third parties may use cookies to collect information on your device and usage patterns. Please refer to their respective privacy policies for more details.

4. Managing Cookies

You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies:

  • Browser Settings: Most browsers let you control cookies through their settings. You can block or delete cookies.

    • Google Chrome Instructions

    • Mozilla Firefox Instructions

    • Safari Instructions

  • Cookie Banners: On your first visit, our cookie banner lets you accept, reject, or customize cookie categories. You can change your choice anytime via the “Cookie Settings” link in the footer.

  • Do Not Track: Some browsers offer “Do Not Track” features; while not legally binding, we respect this preference whenever technically feasible.

Blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience on the Website.

5. Changes to This Cookie Policy

We may update this policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, law, or our practices. Updates will be posted on this page with a revised “Effective Date.”

6. Contact Us

For any questions about our use of cookies, contact:
